alert.note: Alert for Hunterdon; Somerset (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 28 at 1:37AM EST until December 28 at 1:30PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in New Jersey... South Branch Raritan River At Stanton affecting Hunterdon and Somerset Counties. For the Raritan River...including Stanton, Raritan, Manville, Bound Brook...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...South Branch Raritan River at Stanton. * WHEN...From early this morning to this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 5.0 feet, Minor low land flooding downstream of gauge. At 8.0 feet, Right bank and approach to bridge is flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 AM EST Thursday the stage was 7.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early this morning to a crest of 8.5 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage late this morning. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.5 feet on 10/09/2005. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (1 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Stg Time Date South Branch Rar Stanton 8.0 7.0 Thu 1 am 5.1 3.5 8.5 7am 12/28 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 130 PM EST.
